newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts to pause before attack on 116-02.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts to pause before attack on 116-02.

text.p: September gilt futures may scale back at the open on Thursday, awaiting U.S. GDP data later to provide fuel for testing levels above 116-00, analysts said.

Philip Gardiner, analyst at Technical Data in London, said stochastics and the Relative Strength Index turned down on the hourly chart towards the close on Wednesday, suggesting a slide early in the session.
"If we break below 115-23 there won't be anything to stop us until 115-15," said Gardiner. That level was Wednesday's low. The high at 116-02 was likely to be initial resistance.
At 0710 GMT, the September gilt was 6/32 down at 115-23.
Gardiner said further support would come from 115-04, the bottom of a recent congestion area that topped at around 115-23.
Analysts at Chase in London said it was important to hold the trend and Elliott support intervening at 115-02, although a decline below there must be confirmed by a close below 114-30.
They said in a research note short-term support intervened at 115-23 and from there gilts should put trendline resistance at 116-06/09 on weekly and daily charts under pressure.
"It might go above 116-02 but not very far," said Technical Data's Gardiner. He saw a Fibonacci projection level of 116-13, and above there 117-02 on the weekly chart as the next barriers.
The U.S. GDP data for the second quarter is due at 1230 GMT, and analysts are looking for a 1.9 percent rise.

Chase analysts said given bullish momentum indicators a drift below 115-02 was unlikely, while the momentum would be further underlined on a break of 116-09, suggesting a move to 117-13 and then to 117-25.
At the short end of the curve, December short sterling futures stood 0.03 down on the day at 92.58.
